newsitem.title: PERU: IMF team to evaluate Peru's record in September.
newsitem.headline: IMF team to evaluate Peru's record in September.

text.p: An International Monetary Fund (IMF) team will arrive in Peru during the first week of September to evaluate the administration's first half macroeconomic results, government sources said.
The mission, to be led by Nicaraguan economist Luis Duran, will be the first IMF team to visit Peru since the signing in June of a three-year macroeconomic target accord.
Peru agreed with the IMF to a target of 4.5 percent growth and inflation between 9.5 percent and 11.5 percent in 1996.
